verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the LORD would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.
verses.web: When LORD was about to take Elijah up by a whirlwind into heaven, Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.
verses.ct: When the LORD was about to take Elijah up into heaven by a whirlwind, Elijah and Elisha set out from Gilgal.

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the LORD hath sent me to Bethel. And Elisha said unto him, As the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Bethel.
verses.web: Elijah said to Elisha, “Please wait here, for LORD has sent me as far as Bethel.” Elisha said, “As LORD lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.
verses.ct: Elijah said to Elisha, "Please stay here, because the LORD has sent me to Bethel." But Elisha replied, "As surely as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, I will not leave you." So they went down to Bethel.

verses.kjv: And the sons of the prophets that were at Bethel came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.
verses.web: The sons of the prophets who were at Bethel came out to Elisha, and said to him, “Do you know that LORD will take away your master from your head today?” He said, “Yes, I know it. Hold your peace.”
verses.ct: The sons of the prophets at Bethel came out to Elisha and asked him, "Do you know that the LORD is going to take your master away from you today?" He answered, "Yes, I know. Be quiet about it."

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the LORD hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, As the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.
verses.web: Elijah said to him, “Elisha, please wait here, for LORD has sent me to Jericho.” He said, “As LORD lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” So they came to Jericho.
verses.ct: Then Elijah said to him, "Elisha, please stay here, because the LORD has sent me to Jericho." But he replied, "As surely as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, I will not leave you." So they went to Jericho.

verses.kjv: And the sons of the prophets that were at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the LORD will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.
verses.web: The sons of the prophets who were at Jericho came near to Elisha, and said to him, “Do you know that LORD will take away your master from your head today?” He answered, “Yes, I know it. Hold your peace.”
verses.ct: The sons of the prophets at Jericho approached Elisha and asked him, "Do you know that the LORD is going to take your master away from you today?" He answered, "Yes, I know. Be quiet about it."

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for the LORD hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, As the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on.
verses.web: Elijah said to him, “Please wait here, for LORD has sent me to the Jordan.” He said, “As LORD lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.” Then they both went on.
verses.ct: Then Elijah said to him, "Please stay here, because the LORD has sent me to the Jordan." But he replied, "As surely as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, I will not leave you." So the two of them walked on together.

verses.kjv: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan.
verses.web: Fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood opposite them at a distance; and they both stood by the Jordan.
verses.ct: 50 men from the sons of the prophets went and stood at a distance, watching, while the two of them stood beside the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground.
verses.web: Elijah took his mantle, and rolled it up, and struck the waters, and they were divided here and there, so that they both went over on dry ground.
verses.ct: Elijah took his mantle, rolled it up, and struck the water. The water divided to the left and right, and the two of them crossed over on dry ground.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.
verses.web: When they had gone over, Elijah said to Elisha, “Ask what I shall do for you, before I am taken from you.” Elisha said, “Please let a double portion of your spirit be on me.”
verses.ct: After they had crossed, Elijah said to Elisha, "Tell me what I can do for you before I am taken from you." Elisha said, "Please, let me inherit a double portion of your spirit."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.
verses.web: He said, “You have asked a hard thing. If you see me when I am taken from you, it will be so for you; but if not, it will not be so.”
verses.ct: Elijah replied, "You have asked for something difficult. However, if you see me when I am taken from you, it will be yours. But if you don't see me, it will not."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.
verses.web: As they continued on and talked, behold, a chariot of fire and horses of fire separated them, and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.
verses.ct: As they were walking along and talking together, suddenly a chariot of fire pulled by horses of fire appeared and separated the two of them, and Elijah went up into heaven in a whirlwind.

verses.kjv: And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.
verses.web: Elisha saw it, and he cried, “My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and its horsemen!” He saw him no more. Then he took hold of his own clothes, and tore them in two pieces.
verses.ct: Elisha saw it and cried out, "My father! My father! The chariots of Israel and its horsemen!" Then he could no longer see him. He grabbed his own clothes and tore them in two.

verses.kjv: He took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Jordan;
verses.web: He also took up Elijah’s mantle that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of the Jordan.
verses.ct: He picked up the mantle that had fallen from Elijah, went back, and stood on the bank of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where is the LORD God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.
verses.web: He took Elijah’s mantle that fell from him, and struck the waters, and said, “Where is LORD, the God of Elijah?” When he also had struck the waters, they were divided apart, and Elisha went over.
verses.ct: He took the mantle that had fallen from Elijah and struck the water, saying, "Where is the LORD, the God of Elijah?" When he struck the water, it divided to the left and right, and Elisha crossed over.

verses.kjv: And when the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.
verses.web: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho facing him saw him, they said, “The spirit of Elijah rests on Elisha.” They came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.
verses.ct: When the sons of the prophets from Jericho, who had been watching from a distance, saw him, they said, "The spirit of Elijah rests on Elisha." They went to meet him and bowed down to the ground before him.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure the Spirit of the LORD hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send.
verses.web: They said to him, “See now, there are with your servants fifty strong men. Please let them go and seek your master. Perhaps LORD’s Spirit has taken him up, and put him on some mountain, or into some valley.” He said, “Don’t send them.”
verses.ct: They said to him, "Look, your servants have 50 strong men. Please let them go search for your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the LORD has carried him away and set him down on some mountain or in some valley." But he said, "Do not send them."

verses.kjv: And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.
verses.web: When they urged him until he was ashamed, he said, “Send them.” Therefore they sent fifty men; and they searched for three days, but didn’t find him.
verses.ct: However, they kept urging him until he was too embarrassed to refuse, so he said, "Go ahead, send them." They sent 50 men, and they searched for 3 days but did not find him.

verses.kjv: And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?
verses.web: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, “Didn’t I tell you, ‘Don’t go?’ ”
verses.ct: When they returned to him — he had stayed in Jericho — he said to them, "Didn't I tell you not to go?"

verses.kjv: And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water is naught, and the ground barren.
verses.web: The men of the city said to Elisha, “Behold, please, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord sees; but the water is bad, and the land is barren.”
verses.ct: The men of the city said to Elisha, "As you can see, my lord, this city has a pleasant location, but the water is bad and the land is barren."

verses.kjv: And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought it to him.
verses.web: He said, “Bring me a new jar, and put salt in it.” Then they brought it to him.
verses.ct: He said, "Bring me a new bowl and put salt in it." So they brought it to him.

verses.kjv: And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus saith the LORD, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren land.
verses.web: He went out to the spring of the waters, and threw salt into it, and said, “LORD says, ‘I have healed these waters. There shall not be from there any more death or barren wasteland.’ ”
verses.ct: He went out to the spring and threw the salt into it, saying, "This is what the LORD says: 'I have healed this water. It will no longer cause death or make the land barren.'"

verses.kjv: So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.
verses.web: So the waters were healed to this day, according to Elisha’s word which he spoke.
verses.ct: The water has remained pure to this day, just as Elisha had spoken.

verses.kjv: And he went up from thence unto Bethel: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.
verses.web: He went up from there to Bethel. As he was going up by the way, some youths came out of the city and mocked him, and said to him, “Go up, you baldy! Go up, you baldy!”
verses.ct: From there he went up to Bethel. As he was walking along the road, some youths came out of the city and mocked him, shouting, "Go on up, you baldhead! Go on up, you baldhead!"

verses.kjv: And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the LORD. And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.
verses.web: He looked behind him and saw them, and cursed them in LORD’s name. Then two female bears came out of the woods, and mauled forty-two of those youths.
verses.ct: He turned around, looked at them, and cursed them in the name of the LORD. Then 2 female bears came out of the woods and mauled 42 of the youths.

verses.kjv: And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.
verses.web: He went from there to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.
verses.ct: From there he traveled to Mount Carmel, and then he returned to Samaria.
